name: FieldRoot
description:
Groups all parts of the field.
Renders a `<div>` element.

name.description:
Identifies the field when a form is submitted.
Takes precedence over the `name` prop on the `<Field.Control>` component.

actionsRef.description:
A ref to imperative actions.
- `validate`: Validates the field when called.

dirty.description:
Whether the field's value has been changed from its initial value.
Useful when the field state is controlled by an external library.

touched.description:
Whether the field has been touched.
Useful when the field state is controlled by an external library.

disabled.description:
Whether the component should ignore user interaction.
Takes precedence over the `disabled` prop on the `<Field.Control>` component.

invalid.description:
Whether the field is invalid.
Useful when the field state is controlled by an external library.

validate.type: ((value: unknown, formValues: Form.Values<string, any>) => string | string[] | Promise<string | string[] | null> | null)
validate.description:
A function for custom validation. Return a string or an array of strings with
the error message(s) if the value is invalid, or `null` if the value is valid.
Asynchronous functions are supported, but they do not prevent form submission
when using `validationMode="onSubmit"`.
validate.detailedType:
| ((
    value: unknown,
    formValues: Form.Values<string, any>,
  ) =>
    | string
    | string[]
    | Promise<string | string[] | null>
    | null)
| undefined

validationMode.description:
Determines when the field should be validated.
This takes precedence over the `validationMode` prop on `<Form>`.

- `onSubmit`: triggers validation when the form is submitted, and re-validates on change after submission.
- `onBlur`: triggers validation when the control loses focus.
- `onChange`: triggers validation on every change to the control value.

validationDebounceTime.description:
How long to wait between `validate` callbacks if
`validationMode="onChange"` is used. Specified in milliseconds.

className.description:
CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.
render.detailedType:
| ReactElement
| ((
    props: HTMLProps,
    state: Field.Root.State,
  ) => ReactElement)

data-disabled.description: Present when the field is disabled.

data-valid.description: Present when the field is valid.

data-invalid.description: Present when the field is invalid.

data-dirty.description: Present when the field's value has changed.

data-touched.description: Present when the field has been touched.

data-filled.description: Present when the field is filled.

data-focused.description: Present when the field control is focused.
